item.description: Back to Portfolio Counting to 10 in Binary Binary isn’t scary! Here we can see a very simple example of how it works, and what it looks like when we count to 10.

Blog 7.21.2022 - Personal, Productive, Political: Can a Tech Company Stay out of Politics? Nearing the end of a company wide meeting, a VP read aloud an employee question regarding the company’s stance on recent reproductive rulings and whether or not the company will weigh in. They shared empathy for employees grappling with... 6.28.2022 - Hindsight is 20/22: Things I Wish I Knew When I Started My Tech Career I realized recently that I’ve hit four years since graduating undergrad and starting a full time job as a software engineer in 2018.
Interactive Online Plotting with Pyodide & Plotly

Currently Reading A Court of Frost and Starlight (A Court of Thorns and Roses, #3.1) Maas, Sarah J. The Age of Surveillance Capitalism: The Fight for a Human Future at the New Frontier of Power Zuboff, Shoshana Invisible Women: Data Bias in a World Designed for Men Criado Pérez, Caroline Previously Read All Things Aside: Absolutely Correct Opinions Shlesinger, Iliza

Back to Portfolio A Non-Technical Introduction to Docker When life gives you containers. How to run the perfect lemonade stand, every time Docker is a tool that allows you to define and contain everything needed to make an application run, as well as the tools to run that application in a way that will be consistent outside of the environment it was developed in. Rather than an application on a computer, imagine we are running a lemonade stand.
Written Content Non-Technical Introduction to Docker Visual Content WebAuthn and Why it Works Public Key Cryptography Counting in Binary
Back to Portfolio Public Key Cryptography The following is a visual representation of public key cryptography being used for encryption, signing, validation, and decryption, in that order.

Back to Portfolio WebAuthn The following is a visual and written explanation as to the security properties of WebAuthn, an authentication protocol that provides strong authentication without the need for passwords or any other devices.
